techmeme.title: Microsoft says it didn't cut services to the International Criminal Court, after an AP report in May said it "cancelled" the email of ICC prosecutor Karim Khan (Sam Clark/Politico)
ChatGPT-4o, Claude 3.7 Sonnet, Gemini 2.0 Flash, Llama 4, and Copilot comparison: Claude was the best overall with the highest consistency and no hallucinations (Geoffrey A. Fowler/Washington Post)
GlobalFoundries plans to spend $16B to boost domestic chip production, including $13B for its New York and Vermont plants and $3B for advanced packing research (Ian King/Bloomberg)
Reddit now lets users hide posting and commenting history on their profiles via a "Content and Activity" setting, as part of a new "Curate your profile" section (Sarah Perez/TechCrunch)
Brookfield says it plans to invest ~$10B to build an AI data center in the Swedish city of Strangnas, after committing to spend €20B in France earlier in 2025 (Supantha Mukherjee/Reuters)
